Joseph leads Mary and the child on a donkey through a Northern European landscape in which the folds of the hills and the handling of light are used to suggest distance.  The pedestal, from which the pagan idol will fall (or has fallen already) as Jesus passes, has been placed so far against the left border that the incident is only suggested Â– the artist seems more interested in his background painting. As with other pages in this Flemish book of hours (on which see Image 275), there is a lavishly detailed border of flowers, butterflies, snails, caterpillars and dragonflies.
